Package com.cafean.client.values.components

Class AbstractCTable

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.cafean.client.values.components.AbstractValue
      • com.cafean.client.values.components.AbstractCTable
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    CloneableBlock, Checkable, ComponentElement, IdentHolder, ModelElement, SharedVariableSupport, java.lang.Cloneable, javax.swing.undo.StateEditable
    public abstract class AbstractCTable
extends AbstractValue
implements Checkable, CloneableBlock, ComponentElement, javax.swing.undo.StateEditable, IdentHolder, SharedVariableSupport
    A base class for data structures which wish to be treated like tables. Implementations must provide arrays of values in the form of NumericsTableColumn instances.

    Each table has a signature based on its column structure: this signature is a string of fully qualified class names seperated by a delimiter. As defined, signatures are guaranteed to be unique for any given combination of types, which makes type compatiblity testing a simple equals check between two Strings.

    Signatures help define a contract between CTables and SharedTables:

    1. No CTable shall reference a SharedTable with a different signature.
    2. No CTable whose signature may vary will allow referencing.
    3. No SharedTable shall alter its signature after it is added to the model.
    While not strictly enforced, various utilities in this library assumes this contract is followed.

    Several methods rely on getColumns to calculate their result. In the worst case (the shared value foreign-key is set to a non-zero, but unresolvable value), this method costs both a look-up and an allocation. Implementations may want to override several methods where direct values can be substituted (such as getRowCount()) when the shared value cannot be resolved.

      • setLocalColumns

        public abstract void setLocalColumns​(NumericsTableColumn[] val_)
                              throws TableException,
                                     java.lang.NullPointerException
        Sets the data in this table in the form of an array of NumericsTableColumn instances.
        Parameters:
        val_ - the new column values
        Throws:
        TableException - if the columns in val_ are not in the same order as those returned by getColumns
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if val_ is null

      • reconnectIdentReferences

        public void reconnectIdentReferences​(boolean preserveUnresolved,
                                     boolean useDbId)
        Description copied from interface: IdentHolder
        Resets this component's internal ident references to refer to appropriate components in the current AbstractModel. Intended for use after adding a component to a model and thus it's DB_ID will have been set to it's ident in the previous model. For ident references use find__ByDbId to find the new component, then store it's ident.

        Note: If this component's DB_ID is 0 this method does nothing.

        Specified by:
        reconnectIdentReferences in interface IdentHolder
        Parameters:
        preserveUnresolved - if true, ident references that aren't resolvable will be left dangling, if false, they will be set to 0.
        useDbId - if true, ident references will be reconnected via find_x_ByDB_ID; if false, ident references will be reconnected via find_x_ByIdent

      • getColumns

        public NumericsTableColumn[] getColumns()
        Returns the data of this table in the form of an array of NumericsTableColumn instances. This method shall return the columns in a referenced SharedTable if the table's mode is set to MODE_REFERENCE and the shared value foreign-key points to a valid table; otherwise the contents of getLocalColumns are returned.

        Note: In the worst case, this method costs both a lookup and an allocation.

      • getRowCount

        public int getRowCount()
        Returns the number of rows in the table. This method returns the number of rows in the first column, or 0 if no columns exist.

      • copyReferenceData

        public void copyReferenceData()
        If a valid SharedTable reference exists, this method stores a deep-copy of that table's data and clears the reference.

      • isReferencingAllowed

        public boolean isReferencingAllowed()
        Returns whether referencing is allowed for this CTable; tables whose signatures may vary for any reason must return false.

      • addRow

        public void addRow​(int row)
        Insert a row into this table's local columns
        Parameters:
        row - the index to insert the row or -1 to append the row.

      • getMaxRowCount

        public int getMaxRowCount()
        Returns the maximum number of rows allowed in this table.

        The default implementation returns Integer.MAX_VALUE and should be overridden by derivatives that have a maximum size.

      • getDefault

        public java.lang.Object getDefault​(int column)
        Retrieves the default value for the given column.

      • isResizeable

        public boolean isResizeable()
        Determines if this table can be resized. If this is true, then the Add and remove buttons are enabled.

      • getSpecificTable

        public javax.swing.JTable getSpecificTable()
        Used by extending classes to set a specific table. Return null if the default of NumericsClipboardEnabledTable is sufficient.
        Returns:
        a JTable built by a plugin to provide plugin specific table functionality

      • isCellEditable

        public boolean isCellEditable​(int row,
                              int column)
        Should be overriden by implementations if certain cells should not be editable. The default implementation returns true.
        Parameters:
        row - the row index of the cell
        column - the column index of the cell
        Returns:
        a true if the cell is editable; a false otherwise

      • createColumnSignature

        public static java.lang.String createColumnSignature​(NumericsTableColumn[] columns)
        Creates a signature indicating the columns types of the given column array. This method will create a unique String for any given combination of types. Table compatability can then be checked with a simple equals between signatures.
        Parameters:
        columns - the columns used to create the signature
        Returns:
        the signature

      • getLocalSignature

        public java.lang.String getLocalSignature()
        Returns the signature of this table.

      • convert

        public void convert​(java.lang.String value)

      • setValue

        public void setValue​(SharedTable table)
        This implementation of set value checks to see if the signature of the provided table matches the local signature: if false, the method fails silently; if true, the shared value reference is set to the table and the local columns are cleared of values.
